summary: The U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New Jersey today entered a final judgment in favor of the estate of Anthony Calleo, a New Jersey resident who died on July 24, 2013.  According to the court's order, filed in federal district court in Newark, New Jersey, on August 2, 2013, the Court found that, in contemplation of death, the Decedent executed a will devising all of his estate, real, personal or mixed, for a sum of less than $100. The court also found that the transfer was not deemed to have taken effect at the time of death.  The Court also ruled that, contrary to the Court's finding, the transfer had the effect of a shift in beneficial interest from one person to another, and that the estate was not subject to the inheritance tax.
